items.content_html:
Summary

This PR updates compat data associated with the Payment Handler API. Ther are a few weird things going on here; you can read my research document to find out the full story.

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Adding the declarativeNetRequest API.

items.title: Add declarativeNetRequest

items.content_html:
Summary

Add support for start and end on align-items for Safari 16.

Test results and supporting details

Navigate to https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items in Chrome (107.0.5304.110) and Safari (16). Visually compare behavior of Results section.

Compared values:

  • normal
  • flex-start
  • flex-end
  • start
  • end

Screenshot of Safari 16 with one of the aforementioned values:

As for existing bug reports, I didn't find anything specific to align-items -- I will admit I am not acquainted with searching for bugs in webkit. A a comment in a similar report mentions that many flexbox bugs were fixed by Feb 2022.

Related issues
items.title: Safari supports `start` and `end`

items.content_html:
Summary

overflow-wrap: anywhere is now supported in Safari (https://twitter.com/jensimmons/status/1515042940783104002). It should be from Safari 15.4 according to #17012 (comment).

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

Fixes #17012
items.title: Add Safari support for `overflow-wrap: anywhere`

items.content_html:
Summary

These changes were generated procedurally by the mdn-bcd-collector project [1] using data collected from Chrome for Android [2].

[1] https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-collector
commit 06ea2714451c548934849011e4106b3175adfab5
[2] https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-results
commit f37e6db1da24143bf039ed8e269c9f234d2b4e90

Test results and supporting details

Related issues

This changeset is based on the one originally submitted via #17908. It uses compatibility data which has been collected since that patch was created, and it includes only a subset of the changes generated by the mdn-bcd-collector.
items.title: Update support data for Chrome Android (API's T through Z)

items.content_html:
Summary

The keepalive parameter to the Fetch (and Request) API is still not supported by Firefox and this is likely to catch people out.

This PR grabs the fetch param data from the Request API to make this clearer (located in api/Request.json).

Test results and supporting details

Symlinked build dir into mdn/content and checked build.

Related issues
items.title: Add fetch keepalive compat data

items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects version values for Chromium (Chrome, Opera, Samsung Internet, WebView Android) for the various Audio APIs, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0 + v7.1.0).

Tests Used:
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioContext
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioDestinationNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/AudioNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/BaseAudioContext
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/BiquadFilterNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/DynamicsCompressorNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/MediaStreamAudioDestinationNode
https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/WaveShaperNode

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Update Chromium versions for Audio APIs

items.content_html:
This PR is a part of a project to add missing interfaces and interface features to BCD that are from an active spec (including WICG specs) and is supported in at least one browser. This particular PR adds the missing slotchange_event member of the ShadowRoot API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/ShadowRoot/slotchange_event

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.ShadowRoot.slotchange_event feature

items.content_html:

This particular PR adds the missing [dis]connect_event member of the Serial API, populating the results using data from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v7.0.0).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.gooborg.com/tests/api/Serial/[dis]connect_event

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add missing api.Serial.[dis]connect_event feature

items.content_html: This PR removes all of the features that are marked obsolete by #17743 for the API folder. All of the features were confirmed to be considered irrelevant or unsupported as validated by the mdn-bcd-collector project.
items.title: Remove obsolete API features

items.content_html:
Summary

Recent versions of Firefox and Safari ignore "unsafe" referer-policies like "unsafe-url".

Test results and supporting details

  • Firefox bug about the removal: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1720294
  • Experimentally, it seems that Safari is ignoring them since version 13
  • Here's a test page: https://home.in.tum.de/~wernerbe/firefox-referrer-bug.html?a=b
    • When the corresponding header is supported, the first two iframes should include the full referrer (including path and query params) in the output, and clicking the link should show the origin instead of None
items.title: Firefox and Safari now ignore "unsafe" referrer-policies

items.content_html:
It supported it from the moment radial-gradient was unprefixed, not sure why it was marked as not supported. In fact, the relevant examples on the MDN page with at work fine in Safari.

This is the bug where support was added: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=67166
items.title: Fix Safari support for `at` in `radial-gradient`
